intro: Monnina andina, commonly known as Andean bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, adapted to the high-altitude environment where it grows. Monnina andina is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat.
